p: Bacille Calmette– Guérin (BCG), the attenuated form of M. bovis, has been used for more than 80 years to protect children against severe forms of TB ( 45). However, its protective efficacy against pulmonary TB varies from 0 to 80% in adults ( 46); therefore, a more effective vaccine is needed. Prime-boost could be a good strategy for inducing long-term protection combining BCG with other antigens ( 47).
